title: Which typeface in the Adobe Type Classics for Learning library best matches the Art Deco period?
content: Hi everyone. I am designing a poster for a school project. The poster is in the Art Deco style & I am limited to the fonts I have installed on my computer (Type Classics for learning.) Calcite Pro & Chicago are 2 I like best. What do you think? OR ... do you have a better suggestion?
author: connie

comments.content:
No disrespect to John, but you should figure this out: the Art Deco period was mainly during the 1920s and 30s (with a revival c.1970), and characterized by geometric shapes. So categorize the typefaces you have accordingly, and you will come up with a hardcore, authentic choice.   
   
You can find out the dates of the typefaces at the Adobe.com/type website.

Moonglow is more in the Art Nouveau style, no? More uneven, organic.   
   
Certainly neither Calcite nor Chicago is particularly Art Deco.

Thanks Nick. I have looked at Art Deco posters, comparing them to the typefaces I have, trying to match them up, evidently, not too successfully. I like your idea of checking out the dates of the typefaces at the Adobe.com site. I am heading there to do just that now! Thanks also Thomas and John for your imput.

Yes, Nick:   
   
Read Deco, thought Nouveau. Thanks for catching that before it did any harm to people's grades!   
   
I don't see anything Deco-ish on the Type Classics list.
